edition: P.Mich. inv. 3020 (a) + 2794 (a) [A] + P.Cairo inv. ? (= P.Mich. inv. 2787) unpublished (in preparation T. Gagos) [B]
inventory: Ann Arbor, Michigan University, P.Mich. inv. 3020 (a) + 2794 (a) (A) + Cairo, Egyptian Museum, inv. number unknown (B)
author: anon.
contents: hypotheseis to Euripides' Palamedes, Stheneboea, Phrixus, and other plays.
statepreservation:
(A) two fragments joining together, with remains from the top of two columns (upper margin: 2.8 cm);
col. 1 = 18 lines, almost complete for l. 1-5, broken off on both sides for the rest; indented title in l. 6 (Polyeidos);
col. 2 = beginnings of 6 lines; l. 4 in eisthesis, probably new title;
(B) three fragments, apparently all from the hypothesis of Phrixus I; fr. 1 and 2 join immediately (l. 1 = l. 1);
fr. 1 = beginnings of 13 lines;
fr. 2 = 9 lines from the top of a column (upper margin 1.8 cm), broken off on both sides, with title in l. 1 (Phrixos);
fr. 3 = 9 lines, broken off on both sides.
hand: small to medium-sized, informal, round, upright, bilinear and fairly regular, with hooks on certain letters.
